plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A small bulbous perennial known for its early bloom in late winter to early spring. It features cup-shaped flowers that emerge from the ground when snow is still present in some regions.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late winter to early spring (February to April)
plants.funFact: Crocus flowers were historically used to produce saffron spice, though the culinary saffron comes from a different species, Crocus sativus.

plants.name: Prunus mume
plants.commonName: Japanese Apricot or Chinese Plum Blossom
plants.description: A deciduous tree known for its fragrant early blossoms appearing in winter before the leaves unfold. It holds cultural significance in East Asia as a symbol of resilience and perseverance.
plants.funFact: Plum blossoms are celebrated in traditional festivals in Japan and China, often representing hope and renewal.

plants.name: Daphne mezereum
plants.description: A small deciduous shrub with intensely fragrant, pink to purple flowers appearing in late winter before the leaves develop. It is often a source of early nectar for pollinators.
plants.funFact: Despite its beauty and fragrance, all parts of Daphne mezereum are toxic if ingested.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree that flowers in the southern hemisphere's late summer through winter, producing bright yellow flower spikes that attract birds and insects.
plants.funFact: Banksias have woody flower spikes that develop into seed cones, and they are important for Australian ecosystems.
